sub_title: Lead Expert in Water Resilient Cities | Water Urbanism | Deltares
summary:
Nanco Dolman is lead expert in Water Resilient Cities at Deltares with a MSc in Civil Engineering from Delft University of Technology (1998) and a BLA in landscape architecture from Amsterdam Academy of Architecture (2008). From 2011 to 2016 Nanco was part time lecturer Adaptive Urban Development at Rotterdam University of Applied Sciences. And since 2015, Nanco serves as UN-ISDR Resilient Cities advocate.
As one of the Dutch front runners in Water Sensitive Urban Design (WSUD) Nanco is specialized in bridging water resilient design and engineering in making cities less vulnerable to water extremes, urban heat, degrading environments, and on-going population growth. Following his international experience in various adaptation strategies for delta cities (a.o. Bangkok, Rotterdam, New Orleans, New York), Nanco became the Water Sensitive City expert for the EU funded Interreg CATCH research project which focusses on "applying the Water Sensitive City framework for climate adaptation in the North Sea Region".

awards.title: Smart Growth Award
awards.description: On June 9, 2016 the Rebuild by Design [Resist, Delay, Store, Discharge] project - a Comprehensive Urban Water Strategy for the Hudson Waterfront [Hoboken], was among the 'New Jersey Future 2016 Smart Growth Award' winners.

awards.title: ASLA professional award (honor), in: analysis and planning category
awards.description: Dallas Connected Cities – The area between the City of Dallas and the Trinity River Corridor is currently dominated by highways and underdeveloped land. This zone forms a moat around Dallas, truncating downtown at Dealey Plaza and severing the city from the waterfront. This planning vision seeks to connect downtown Dallas and the Trinity River Corridor and to re-envision the zone between them as a vibrant new linear city.

awards.title: Merit Paper Award - Towards Water Adaptive Cities
awards.description:
Merit Paper Award presented to:
Marten Hillen and Nanco Dolman, for the paper entitled:
Towards Water Adaptive Cities, presented at the:
World Engineers Summit (WES) on Climate Change 2015, 21 - 24 July 2015, Singapore.
awards.issuer: World Engineers Summit (WES) on Climate Change 2015

awards.title: National Planning Excellence Award for Environmental Planning
awards.description:
In May 2015 the APA’s 2015 National Planning Awards Jury selected the Greater New Orleans Urban Water Plan to receive the National Planning Excellence Award for Environmental Planning. This is the highest honor the APA can bestow upon a project, which was found to be the best in the category.
To quote only a few excerpts from APA National, the plan was named “the first regional water plan of its kind in the country”, “a vision with urgency and significance”, and “an elemental change in the region’s approach to water management”.

awards.title: Role Model City - certificate
awards.description:
The United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNISDR) has designated the City of Hoboken, New Jersey, USA, as a Role Model City of the Making Cities Resilient campaign for its flood risk management practices. These include the [Resist, Delay, Store, Discharge] project - a Comprehensive Urban Water Strategy for Hoboken.
“We are honored to be recognized for our efforts to make Hoboken more resilient,” said Mayor Dawn Zimmer. “Through a multi-layered approach to resiliency, we are on the cusp of solving a more than century-old flooding problem.”
Hoboken is one of 45 cities worldwide recognized as a Role Model City by the United Nations. There are over 2,400 cities and towns worldwide participating in the campaign, including 73 capital cities, representing a collective population of 700 million people.
awards.issuer: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNISDR)

awards.title: Honor Award in Master Planning and Urban Design
awards.description: On March 26, 2015, Waggonner & Ball was proud to receive – on behalf of the entire 'Greater New Orleans Urban Water Plan' team – the 2015 Honor Award in Master Planning and Urban Design by the American Institute of Architects’ New Orleans Chapter.
awards.issuer: American Institute of Architects (AIA) New Orleans Chapter

awards.title: Planning Excellence Award
awards.description:
On January 30, 2014, The Greater New Orleans Urban Water Plan Team and Waggonner & Ball Architects received the Planning Excellence Award for the Greater New Orleans Urban Water Plan. This award was presented at the American Planning Association, Louisiana Chapter’s State Planning Conference in New Orleans.
“We congratulate Waggonner & Ball and their international team of water experts for receiving the Planning Excellence Award for the Greater New Orleans Urban Water Plan,” said Michael Hecht, President of CEO of Greater New Orleans, Inc. “In a world of increasing weather volatility, implementation of the Urban Water Plan is imperative to our region’s economic future as well as to our safety and quality of life. This award recognizes Louisiana’s expertise and experience that is and will be valuable to addressing water challenges nationally and globally.

“Working with water in Louisiana is elemental,” said David Waggonner, Principal at Waggonner and Ball Architects. “It’s the source of who we are, the reason we are here. Making water the root of our urban plan restores the balance we need to adapt and gives us a sound, attractive basis for long term investment.”

profile_positions.description:
By bridging water engineering and urban design, I'm recognized as one of the front runners in Water Urbanism: which promotes that our architecture and urban interventions must consider the changing climate as the new 'normal'. In the transition towards Water-Resilient Cities, I work with Water-Sensitive Urban Design (WSUD), Blue-Green Infrastructure (BGI) and Nature-based Solutions (NbS) in urban areas. At Deltares I divide my activities between:
• Urban Water and Subsurface Management (department)
• Resilient Cities (research program)
• Urban Resilience (transdisciplinary team)
profile_positions.title: Lead Expert in Water Resilient Cities | Water Urbanism
ISO/TC 207/SC 7/TG 2 "Climate Adaptation" committee member on-behalf of NEN

profile_positions.description: Journal of Water and Climate Change publishes refereed research and practitioner papers on all aspects of water science, technology, management and innovation in response to climate change. Read more at; http://jwcc.iwaponline.com/. The role of Editor includes making policy decisions with the Editor-in-Chief and other Editors; peer review of submissions for publication in the journal; as well as encouraging high quality submissions to the journal.
profile_positions.title: Editor Journal of Water & Climate Change

profile_positions.description: Journal of Water and Climate Change publishes refereed research and practitioner papers on all aspects of water science, technology, management and innovation in response to climate change. Read more at; http://jwcc.iwaponline.com/
profile_positions.title: Reviewer Journal of Water & Climate Change

profile_positions.description: The Journal of Hydrology publishes original research papers and comprehensive reviews in all the subfields of the hydrological sciences including water based management and policy issues that impact on economics and society. Read more at; https://www.journals.elsevier.com/journal-of-hydrology
profile_positions.title: Reviewer Journal of Hydrology

profile_positions.description:
Water and airport planning, airport drainage, reducing emissions winter operation, monitoring water quality, climate resilience
• Water management strategic plan 2015
• Water vision 2030 - Climate Adaptation Strategy
• Strategic water investment plan (SIW) 2030
profile_positions.title: Strategic advisor Water Management Schiphol Airport

profile_positions.description: Leading Professional in Water Resilient Cities with a global focus. Because 90% of all natural hazards are water-related, Royal HaskoningDHV advocates its international experience on “Planning for Flood Resilience and Adaptation for Climate Change”. Within this area I focus on the flood resilience of valuable assets & critical infrastructure, like sea ports and airports. And for this effort I work with international leading experts in flood resilience, urban water management, ecology, urban design and in master planning.
profile_positions.title: Leading Professional in Water Resilient Cities

profile_positions.title: Klimaat-deskundige (projectbasis)

profile_positions.description:
The Water Management education at the Rotterdam University of applied sciences is part of the Institute for Built Environment. By focusing on "Sustainable development of urban conglomerations in delta areas" the education means a deepening in:
* Delta Technology (everything to do with water systems and water management).
* Delta Design (designing new forms of housing, construction and working on/ with the water).
* Delta Management (adapting each solution to its environment by strategic spatial planning).
profile_positions.title: Lecturer Water Management in Urban Areas

profile_positions.description:
As part of the STOWA Water Mosaic knowledge program:
Development and implementation of "Volg- en StuurSysteem" (track and control instrument) for water system analysis and assessment of Water Framework Directive measures. Analysis of the water system by the track and control instrument provides (at a glance) insight into the effectiveness and dependencies of hydrological catchments in relation to its environment.
profile_positions.title: Strategic advisor Volg- en StuurSysteem (secondment)
